TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 356
TEI.2.document_title: Richard Thurmond to Stephen F. Austin, 02-15-1820

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 356

div1.p: Richard Thurmond to Stephen F. Austin, February 28, 1820. Receipts for goods.
Recd of Stephen F. Austin one thousand and Seventy four pounds of Pork at nine Dollars pr. hundred
also recd fifty two bushel of corn at Seventy five cents per bushel
20. 00 also recd 40 yards cloth @ 50 cts pr yard
Rich. Thurmond Witness John M. Bradley
There is some doubt as to seven yards of the clothe mentioned in the within which is to be proven by L. Furguson
